title: Adding An Easy Shortcut to the JSLint javascript validator to Visual Studio
body: <p><strong>Update:</strong> <a href="http://travis.servebeer.com/blog.net/2011/05/13/Adding+An+Easy+Shortcut+To+The+JSHint+Javascript+Validator+To+Visual+Studio.aspx">2011-05-13: JSLint WSH no longer available, see JSHint WSH</a>.</p><hr/><p>Ever <a href="http://twitter.com/travis/status/3535412717" title="me too!">wish that Visual Studio had a JSLint add-in</a>? Inspired by <a href="http://twitter.com/happygiraffe/statuses/3561385301" title="thx @happygiraffe!">a reply to my tweet</a>, I discovered the following solution.</p><ol><li><p>Grab the <a href="http://jslint.com/wsh/" title="jscript can be useful">WSH version of JSLint</a>.</p></li><li><p>Add this <code>jslint.bat</code> file to the same folder you have JSLint in: </p><pre>@echo offcscript jslint.js //Nologo &#60; %1echo.echo Done.</pre></li><li><p>In Visual Studio &#8594; Tools &#8594; External Tools&#8230;</p></li><li><p>Add a new tool with the following field values: </p><dl><dt>Title:</dt><dd>&#38;JSLint</dd><dt>Command:</dt><dd><var>%YourJSLintPath%</var>\jslint.bat</dd><dt>Arguments:</dt><dd>$(ItemPath)</dd><dt>Initial directory:</dt><dd><var>%YourJSLintPath%</var>\</dd><dt>Use Output window</dt><dd>checked</dd></dl><p><a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/diesel_travis/3874801853/" title="VS: External Tools by T-Rav, on Flickr"><img src="http://farm3.static.flickr.com/2664/3874801853_f73d435536_o.png" width="471" height="458" alt="VS: External Tools" /></a></p></li><li><p>Open up any *.js file you'd like to validate</p></li><li><p>Select the all new JSLint from your tools menu: </p><p><a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/diesel_travis/3875590908/" title="VS: Tools Menu by T-Rav, on Flickr"><img src="http://farm3.static.flickr.com/2657/3875590908_73f59376b9_o.png" width="309" height="502" alt="VS: Tools Menu" /></a></p></li><li><p>Try not to let JSLint hurt your feelings too much: </p><p><a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/diesel_travis/3874801933/" title="VS: Output From JSLint by T-Rav, on Flickr"><img src="http://farm3.static.flickr.com/2487/3874801933_081bc4c19b_o.png" width="459" height="228" alt="VS: Output From JSLint" /></a></p></li></ol><p>In short, <a href="http://jslint.com/" title="yes it is!">JSLint is awesome</a>.</p>
